intro: Neumannia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with lance-shaped leaves and hairy stems. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, round fruits that are edible. Neumannia madagascariensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
